intro: Klasea radiata subsp. radiata, commonly known as the radiate klasea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a radiate pattern, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
